| Maugneshaagar:* can [fly](/wiki/Fly "Fly").
* can [see invisible creatures](/wiki/See_invisible "See invisible").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [demon](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* can [follow](/wiki/Follower "Follower") you to other levels.
* is [nasty](/wiki/M2_NASTY "M2 NASTY").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* wants your [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless").
* hits creatures as a +4 weapon. |                                                                                                                                     |
|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |                                                                                                                                     |
| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line5172](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line5172 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c")                    |

**Maugneshaagar**, &, is the [Necromancer](/wiki/Necromancer "Necromancer") [quest nemesis](/wiki/Quest_nemesis "Quest nemesis") in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). He is a [major demon](/wiki/Major_demon "Major demon") that guards the [Bell of Opening](/wiki/Bell_of_Opening "Bell of Opening") and [The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa](/wiki/The_Great_Dagger_of_Glaurgnaa "The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa"), the Necromancer [quest artifact](/wiki/Quest_artifact "Quest artifact").

## Strategy

### SLASH'EM

Though defeating Maugneshaagar is not too difficult, you will want to prepare adequately before confronting him as his melee attacks pack quite a punch. Because Maugneshaagar starts on the opposite end of the level, you may (in the worst case) need to walk over to him, wake him up, and chase him back to the upstairs in order to kill him. If you can't teleport directly back to the upstairs, you will want to be prepared to take several beatings from him while you walk back to the stairs while he teleports back and forth to attack you. Surviving this punishment will require a strong AC (of -20, at least), supplemented by standard defensive tactics designed to give you time to heal, such as scrolls of scare monster, a reliable means of carving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), or a [wand of extra healing](/wiki/Wand_of_extra_healing "Wand of extra healing").

Maugneshaagar is not particularly sturdy, and a Necromancer with a highly enchanted [Serpent's Tongue](/wiki/Serpent%27s_Tongue "Serpent's Tongue") will find that it does not take many consistent hits to finish him off even with Maugneshaagar's poison resistance.

## Origin

Like the Necromancer pantheon, Maugneshaagar appears to be have been invented solely for SLASH'EM, although his name would not be out of place in the works of [H.P. Lovecraft](/wiki/H.P._Lovecraft "H.P. Lovecraft").

[![This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.](/images/3/38/Se7e7-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article may require revision for the next version of SLASH'EM. Click here for more information.")

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Maugneshaagar

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
& Maugneshaagar
Difficulty 25
Attacks Weapon 8d4, Weapon 4d6, Spell-casting, Claw 2d6 amulet-stealing
& Maugneshaagar
Difficulty 25
Attacks

Weapon 8d4, Weapon 4d6, Spell-casting, Claw 2d6 amulet-stealing

Base level 16
Base experience 601
Speed 10
Base AC -10
Base MR 85
Alignment -20 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) Unique
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size Large
Resistances death magic, fire, poison, level drain
Resistances conveyed None

Maugneshaagar:

  • can fly.
  • can see invisible creatures.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a demon.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • can follow you to other levels.
  • is nasty.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • wants your quest artifact.
  • never leaves a corpse.
  • hits creatures as a +4 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line5172

Maugneshaagar, &, is the Necromancer quest nemesis in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM, and Hack'EM. He is a major demon that guards the Bell of Opening and The Great Dagger of Glaurgnaa, the Necromancer quest artifact.

Strategy

SLASH'EM

Though defeating Maugneshaagar is not too difficult, you will want to prepare adequately before confronting him as his melee attacks pack quite a punch. Because Maugneshaagar starts on the opposite end of the level, you may (in the worst case) need to walk over to him, wake him up, and chase him back to the upstairs in order to kill him. If you can't teleport directly back to the upstairs, you will want to be prepared to take several beatings from him while you walk back to the stairs while he teleports back and forth to attack you. Surviving this punishment will require a strong AC (of -20, at least), supplemented by standard defensive tactics designed to give you time to heal, such as scrolls of scare monster, a reliable means of carving Elbereth, or a wand of extra healing.

Maugneshaagar is not particularly sturdy, and a Necromancer with a highly enchanted Serpent's Tongue will find that it does not take many consistent hits to finish him off even with Maugneshaagar's poison resistance.

Origin

Like the Necromancer pantheon, Maugneshaagar appears to be have been invented solely for SLASH'EM, although his name would not be out of place in the works of H.P. Lovecraft.
